lines.line: Here did they rites, Perimedes and Eurylochus,
Then prayed I many a prayer to the sickly death’s-heads;
Covered with close-webbed mist, unpierced ever
Till I should hear Tiresias.

lines.line: The ocean flowing backward, came we then to the place
For sacrifice, heaping the pyre with goods,
Then prayed I many a prayer to the sickly death’s-heads;

variants.line_variant: Then prayed we hear a sickly to the sickly death’s-heads;

lines.line: Came we then to the bounds of deepest water,

lines.line: Battle spoil, bearing yet dreory arms,
Of youths and of the old who had borne much;
Till I should hear Tiresias.
